intro_lead: This saying best explains my time consuming book procurement, administration and reading process and my disruptive reading technique which enables me to read every free minute and to select only pageturners out of a big variety of books. A dream!!

home_hero_title: Turn waiting time in reading time.
home_hero_lede: PagesInLine is a paperbook-based method to support a relaxed readingexperience. Pocket sections, real-life minutes, visible progress. No smartphone reading. No e-reader. Just pages.
home_bullet_1: Always with you: pocket sections, not a heavy book.
home_bullet_2: Read in real life: station, queue, checkout.
home_bullet_4: Read what you love—drop what you don’t.
home_how_1: Pick a paperback you want to read.
home_how_2: Split it into pocket sections (20–40 pages).
home_how_3: Carry one section and read top-to-bottom.
home_how_4: Use micro-moments (waiting time becomes reading time).
home_how_5: Done pages → recycling (you always know where you stopped).
home_start_lede: Choose one book you actually want. Make one small section. Read every waiting minute today.

info.technik.title: Bookswiping, a game changer
info.technik.p1: Swiping on a smartphone means changing content when you’ve seen enough or don’t like it.
info.technik.p2: With paper books that seemed impossible—until I had the idea to cut my books into small pieces. A new world opened up for me.
info.technik.p3: This technique gave me a lot of advantages:
info.technik.p4: Advantage 1: The pages are always close to me when an occasion for reading comes up—supermarket line, check-in, train, plane, and so on. Advantage 2: I can carry several book parts with me and switch if I’m not hooked. Pages I’ve read go to recycling right away, so I always know where I stopped.
info.ausruestung.title: My equipment
info.ausruestung.p1: There are some things that are necessary to make my reading dream true.
info.ausruestung.p_markers: Once the cover is removed I still want to know which book I am reading. That’s why I register my books in a Google Sheet and mark them with a barcode. Different colors help me recognize them faster in my bookshelf.
info.ausruestung.p_ducktape: To secure loose pages I use a professional duct-tape dispenser. It’s invaluable to keep all pages in the right place.
info.ausruestung.p_bookshelf: My bookshelf is a central part of my reading strategy. I can see my books with the markings I applied. They are dry and safe. If I want to read one, I just take it out—and if I have free space, I add new ones.
info.ausruestung.p_bag: When traveling I use a reading bag to store my books. It’s better than a backpack because I can easily take books out—and also use it for trash.
info.beschaffung.title: How do I get pageturners?
info.beschaffung.p1: I usually buy my books at flea markets.
info.beschaffung.p2: If I look for new books in a shop, I usually go to Hugendubel in Munich at Karlsplatz. There I can test-read and decide if I buy. Also available online.
info.beschaffung.p3: For used books in Munich I recommend Antiquariat Angelika Ziegler, Landsberger Str. 71, 80339 Munich. Big choice and nice personnel. Also online.
info.faq.title: Questions you might have
info.faq.q1: How long have you been doing it already?
info.faq.q2: Don’t you miss the books that are gone?
info.faq.a2: For me reading is a process that happens now and today. If I miss a book, I get it again online. With that many books available, there’s no time to mourn.
info.faq.q3: Do you remember the books that you have read?
info.faq.a3: The great ones yes. I almost never forget if a book was a pageturner.
info.faq.a4: Three main reasons: bigger choice (not all paper books exist digitally), I love the haptic of paper books, and I can put pages in any pocket (and even sit on them).
info.about.title: About me
info.about.lede: What drives me to use a reading technique?
info.about.p1: As a kid, I devoured adventure stories—especially Karl May. Later, life got busy and reading slowly slipped away.
info.about.p2: One day I discovered the 3R technique, and it brought books back into my daily routine. Suddenly even small breaks became reading time.
info.about.p3: Because I can move through books efficiently, my “bad habit” of coming home from bookshops and flea markets with a stack of books finally made sense.
info.about.p4: What I love most: the 3R technique helps me find truly good books faster. I can always keep a few options with me—so I’m never stuck without something worth reading.
